Posts.Content: newmommy wrote: IF someone knows the answer to this please tell me.  I had a diagnostic mammogram last Wednesday (the day before Thanksgiving) and an ultrasound.  I have the report from the radiologist.  It says BI-RAD Category 5: Highly suggestive of Malignancy...Palpable abnormality corresponds to an irregular shadowing mass 11 o'clock in the left breast measuring 1.3x1.1x2.1 cm with marked posterior acoustic shadowing.  Ill-defined hypoechoic solid mass.  I've done some reading and I know this sounds bad.  I have an ultrasound guided core needle biopsy scheduled for Monday afternoon, and then I am supposed to follow up with a general surgeon (not breast specialist) who I met with Tuesday of this week. I have an 8 month old baby girl that I just got done breastfeeding (that's when I found the lump).  I am so scared and I need some support.  I'm happy I found this website.  If anyone has had a similar experience (as far as the radiologist report), please tell me what to expect next.  I need someone to tell it to me straight.  I am a new mother, and yes I'm scared, but I HAVE to know what to prepare for.  Thanks in advance. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: PLEASE tell me the truth newmommy Indomitable1

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2009 07:19PM newmommy wrote: Is anyone from the Atlanta area or from Georgia?  Just curious to know if anyone has had a wonderful experience with a team in this area that you would be comfortable referring me to.  Thanks!
Posts.Title: PLEASE tell me the truth newmommy Indomitable1

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2009 10:31PM newmommy wrote: Hi Ladies, My update- I had my ultrasound guided core biopsy today. It was not the most comfortable because I'm so hard to numb. I felt a little bit more than just pressure. :( I was also unprepared for the drilling sound that the needle made. Anyway, I'm ok tonight. I'm not sore and feeling fine. I should have the results on Wednesday. I'm requesting prayers and positive thoughts. The radiologist that performed the surgery sounded hopeful and gave me some ideas about what kind of benign conditions were possible. Thanks again for your support.
Posts.Title: PLEASE tell me the truth newmommy Indomitable1

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2009 12:03PM newmommy wrote: Thank you so much ladies. You all have been a blessing to me today and I thank God for you. I called a Breast Care Center in Atlanta, I think they are supposed to be the best around here. They can't see me until mid-December so they suggested that I go ahead and have the biopsy as planned on Monday and call to schedule with them after results are in whether positive or negative. Does that sound good? Either way, I may go back to the surgeon for him to give me my results, but I'm not going to him for any surgery or treatment plan IF needed. Also, is a BIRAD category 5 ever NOT cancer?? Anyone experienced that. (Be honest) I LOVE the thorough information and advice. Keep it coming! The more information I have the better I feel. Is that weird? I guess I feel that information is power in these situations. Thanks so much ladies.
Posts.Title: PLEASE tell me the truth newmommy Indomitable1

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2009 07:24AM newmommy wrote: Update- I called the surgeon's office yesterday and they told me that when the report comes in, depending on what it says I may have to come in for an appointment. I was so upset! I told her that I wanted to be told over the phone either way and her response was, "we'll see." Thankfully I also had a copy of the report sent to my GYN and I called them yesterday. One of the dr's was sympathetic and said that she would call me as soon as she got the report (which she expexts to be TODAY) and would let me know over the phone either way. What a relief. I'll be updating later today. Thanks as always for your thoughts and prayers.
Posts.Title: PLEASE tell me the truth newmommy Indomitable1

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2009 11:33AM newmommy wrote: Ladies I am thankful for your love and support.  I have a copy of the pathologist's report.  It says Stromal fibrosis and sclerosis. No malignancy identified.  THANK YOU GOD!  I am concerned that the surgeon's office simply called and said, you're fine with no details.  I pressed for them to fax me the report and they finally did.  Many of you stated that they would probably want to take it out anyway, but there was no mention of that.  I am not one to borrow trouble, but I am still going to the Breast Care Center here in Atlanta and see what they think.  Maybe even have them take a look at the slides??  What does everyone think?
Posts.Title: PLEASE tell me the truth newmommy Indomitable1

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2009 06:20PM newmommy wrote: Thank you ladies again.  I feel much better in spite of my anxiety.  I have taken your advice to heart and feel as if I have a plan.  I am on my way home now and going to hug and kiss my baby girl knowing that no matter what, I'm going to be ok.  Thank you for everything.  I'll update you all next week.  I was told I should know by Wednesday or Thursday.
Posts.Title: PLEASE tell me the truth newmommy Indomitable1

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2009 03:28PM newmommy wrote: Ok Ladies, here is the latest.  I called my gyn today and was told that the report that they have back from the pathologist says "fibrosis and sclerosis" and no malignancy.  They then said to follow up with the surgeon to see what he says and what he wants me to do.  I am happy about "no malignancy" of course, but I'm confused by a couple things, 1) the doctor didn't sound excited about the report; 2) the gyn still wants me to follow up with the surgeon and said that he may want to take it out to be sure??  I know I should be happy right now, and I am, but I just don't understand what is going on, and the surgeon's office is randomly closed today.  Can anyone shed light on what is going on?  I'm in tears still because I don't know if I can breathe again or not?  No matter what, I am forever in you ladies' debt.  You all keep seeing me through all of this confusion and I don't know what I would do without you all.  If my assumption is correct and this condition is benign, I will still come back to this website often and offer support to other ladies.  I have been overwhelmed by your love and support so again, Thank you!  Love and hugs to you all.
Posts.Title: PLEASE tell me the truth newmommy Indomitable1
